Good morning @jgao54,

Thanks for your commit. Personally I'm always in favor of making this simpler. This allows us to focus on the more complex things ;)

Have you tested this in your local environment? There is a lot happening in the logging lately.

Some tests are still failing:
```
======================================================================
13) FAIL: test_default_task_logging_setup (tests.utils.test_log_handlers.TestFileTaskLogHandler)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
    tests/utils/test_log_handlers.py line 46 in test_default_task_logging_setup
      self.assertEqual(handler.name, FILE_TASK_HANDLER)
   AssertionError: 'task' != 'file.task'
======================================================================
14) FAIL: test_file_task_handler (tests.utils.test_log_handlers.TestFileTaskLogHandler)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
    tests/utils/test_log_handlers.py line 56 in test_file_task_handler
      self.assertIsNotNone(file_handler)
   AssertionError: unexpectedly None
======================================================================
15) ERROR: test_get_file_task_log (tests.www.test_views.TestLogView)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
    tests/www/test_views.py line 330 in setUp
      os.path.join(current_dir, 'test_logs'))
   KeyError: 'file.task'
```

Cheers, Fokko
I'm in favor of removing the timestamp from the metric, if no-one has any objections, I will merge this in the coming days.
Nice feature. My suggestion would be to just remove it completely from the DB. Otherwise we might have to test behaviour such as, when a new dag appears with the same id.

@Fokko  Thanks for the feedback! And my bad, just corrected the tests.

I've run this default logging config in my local environment, and log files look consistent to me as before the change. I'll run it on gcs as well just in case, but we don't use s3 here so it would be great if someone could test that one :)
As noted in the other PRs: This PR will not be accepted if it does not adhere to the PR guidelines. Please read them and apply them, then I will happily merge.
Is something missing for this PR?

@Fokko That's a good point, but I think for record keeping, it's still good practice to keep around deleted objects. Maybe that's outside the scope of this PR and should be a larger discussion the Airflow community should have.
couldn't find any unittest related to this part. if someone can point it out, am happy to add it.

      GET /<prefix>/admin/ HTTP/1.1" 200 68476 "http://airflow.myserver/<prefix>/admin/

  On Flower, I need to request the load balancer to strip the pathprefix (With traefik: `traefik.frontend.rule.type: PathPrefixStrip` annotation), so it would access as:

      GET /index.html HTTP/1.1" 200 68476 "http://airflow.myserver/<prefix>/index.hmtl

Action: I would like to align both behavior
